cspaper.name: topic
cspaper.description: the main research area or technique discussed in the paper, choose one from ['Information Retrieval', 'Retrieval-Augmented Generation', 'Data Selection', 'SFT'].

cspaper.name: uses_knowledge_graph
cspaper.description: whether the method explicitly incorporates a knowledge graph as part of retrieval or reasoning choose one from ['Yes', 'No'].

cspaper.name: reasoning_depth
cspaper.description: reasoning path length in the application scenarios of the method by the main task or benchmark, choose one from ['single-hop', 'multi-hop'].

cspaper.name: baseline
cspaper.description: baseline model or system used for comparison in the experiments, list all the baselines mentioned in the text.

cspaper.name: retrieval_method
cspaper.description: primary retrieval method used to obtain supporting information, choose one from ['Dense Retrieval', 'Graph-based Retrieval', 'Hybrid Retrieval', 'Sparse Retrieval', 'Web Search', 'other'].

cspaper.name: generator_model
cspaper.description: name of the generation models used in the system (e.g., GPT-4o-mini, LLaMa2-7B-Chat), list all the baselines mentioned in the text.

cspaper.name: uses_reranker
cspaper.description: whether the system uses an explicit reranker stage to re-score retrieved candidates before generation, choose one from ['Yes', 'No'].

cspaper.name: data_modality
cspaper.description: all modality of the input data handled by the system, choose one or more from ['Audio', 'Image', 'Table', 'Text', 'Code'], e.g. Text; Table; Image.

cspaper.name: evaluation_dataset
cspaper.description: name of the dataset(s) used for evaluation in the experiments, list all the datasets mentioned in the text.

cspaper.name: evaluation_metric
cspaper.description: all the evaluation metric(s) reported in the experiments (e.g.,  Perplexity; BLEU; ROUGE; F1; recall@1).

cspaper.name: application_domain
cspaper.description: primary real-world domain or application scenario targeted by the paper, choose one or more from ['General', 'Education', 'Finance', 'Sports', 'Government', 'Legal', 'Medical', 'Academic', 'Art', 'Other'], e.g. Education; Finance

cspaper.name: use_agent
cspaper.description: whether the system explicitly adopts an agent-style architecture (e.g., tool-calling or multi-step planning) rather than a single forward pass, choose one from ['Yes', 'No'].

cspaper.name: agent_framework
cspaper.description: main agent-style reasoning framework used by the system, choose one from ['CoT', 'ToT', 'Multi-Agent Collaboration', 'Other'], if the system does not use agent, leave it empty.

cspaper.name: performance_on_hotpotqa
cspaper.description: the result or performance of the method on the HotpotQA benchmark. Extract any reported metric(s) such as F1, EM, accuracy, or other values. If multiple metrics are provided, separate them with `||`. If only qualitative descriptions are given (e.g., 'outperforms baseline'), extract them in short free text.

cspaper.name: performance_on_NQ
cspaper.description: the result or performance of the method on the Natural Questions (NQ) benchmark. Extract any reported metric(s) or qualitative descriptions. Use short free-form text if no specific numbers are given.

cspaper.name: multi_turn_retrieval
cspaper.description: whether the method explicitly supports multi-turn retrieval. Only choose one from ['Yes', 'No'].

cspaper.name: baseline_amount
cspaper.description: the number of baselines in this paper.
